questions.stem: Which spelling follows Canadian conventions?
questions.rationale: Canadian spelling uses British -our and -re endings but American -ize endings: colour, centre, organize.

questions.stem: Complete using Canadian spelling: The Minister of __________ announced that the new __________ will __________ community programs.
questions.rationale: Canadian spelling: Labour (not Labor), centre (not center), organize (not organise).

questions.stem: Click on the incorrectly spelled word:

questions.rationale: Canadian spelling: theatre, honour, organize (combining British and American patterns).

questions.stem: Which statement about spelling variants is correct?

options.label: Always use the first spelling listed in the dictionary
Choose one variant and use it consistently throughout the document
Mix variants freely to add variety

questions.rationale: Consistency within a document is more important than which variant you choose.

questions.stem: Choose consistent variants: The financial __________ will help students __________ in the program. The __________ building houses administrative offices.
questions.rationale: Both spellings in each pair are acceptable, but choose one form and use consistently.

questions.stem: Match the context with the preferred variant:
questions.rationale: Different contexts may prefer different variants, but consistency within each document is key.

questions.stem: Click on the inconsistent spelling in this document:
questions.text: The adviser will help enroll students. Later, the advisor will assist with enrolment procedures.
questions.rationale: Consistency requires using the same variant throughout: either adviser/enrol or advisor/enroll.

questions.stem: Which compound word distinction is correct?

options.label: anyone vs. any one have the same meaning
'Anyone can apply' vs. 'Any one person may apply'
always use the closed form (anyone, everyone)
always use the open form (any one, every one)

questions.rationale: 'Anyone' means 'anybody,' while 'any one' means 'any single one.' The meaning determines the form.

questions.stem: Which word endings are spelled correctly?
questions.rationale: Correct spellings follow established patterns: -ment, -ement (for some words), -ible (for certain words).

questions.stem: Complete the word endings: The commit_____ will provide assist_____ to ensure compli_____ with the new guid_____.
questions.rationale: Committee (double t + ee), assistance/compliance/guidance all end in -ance.

questions.stem: Which homophone pair is used correctly?

options.label: The principle concern of the principal
The principal concern of the principle
The principal concern of the principal
The principle concern of the principle

questions.rationale: Principal = main/chief (concern), principal = head person (of school). Principle = rule/standard.
